org.sbrubbles.conditio

Interface Handler

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Function<Condition,Restart.Option>, Predicate<Condition>

    public interface Handler
extends Predicate<Condition>, Function<Condition,Restart.Option>
    Handles conditions by selecting which restart to use. This selection is done by returning a restart option, which is then used to find the appropriate restart, and can hold useful data for the recovery code.

    A handler doesn't necessarily need to handle a condition; it can decline to do so by returning SKIP. The signalling machinery will then search for another handler, bound later in the stack.

    A handler can do two things: check if it can handle a given signal (with Predicate.test(Object)), and analyze a given condition, returning which restart should be used (with Function.apply(Object)). Since it works both as a predicate and as a function, this interface extends both.

    See Also:
    Condition, Restart.Option, Restart, Scope

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Restart.Option SKIP
      Returned when a handler, for whatever reason, opts to not handle a particular condition.

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from interface java.util.function.Predicate

        and, isEqual, negate, or, test

      • Methods inherited from interface java.util.function.Function

        andThen, apply, compose, identity

    • Field Detail

      • SKIP

        static final Restart.Option SKIP
        Returned when a handler, for whatever reason, opts to not handle a particular condition. By returning this, other handlers, bound later in the stack, will have the chance instead.
